name: Orcs Must Die! 2
description: You’ve tossed, burned and sliced them by the thousands – now orcs must die more than ever before! Grab a friend and slay orcs in untold numbers in this sequel to the 2011 AIAS Strategy Game of the Year from Robot Entertainment.

reviews.review_text: One of the must have co-op games - 9/10.

If you have friends, this is a great game to play with them. If you don't have any friends, this is a great game to play alone. If you don't have the game to play, get the money for it. If you don't have the money for it, get a job. If you don't have a job, rob the bank. If you get arrested robbing the bank, at least you tried.
Best orc killing simulator out there ;) best played in co-op

Orcs Must Die 2 is a tower defense type game in which you play one of two characters (male/female) in order to top the Orcish hoard from getting to their destination (of which there are sometimes multiple points to protect.) To assist you there are numerous upgrades for your character, minions, and traps that are unlocked as you progress. You get an action bar where you can put a set number of these things and then start the level. Using some of these things (like minions and traps) costs coins. Coins are independent of each level (they don't carry over so don't be shy about spending them.) You get more as the level progresses and there are other items you can unlock that increase coin drops.   For me, survival mode was the most fun. Still haven't made it to wave 30 of any level yet though (it's hard!) Essentially it's progressively harder and harder waves until you're finally overwhelmed (or make it to that legendary 30th level.)   The fun factor is through the roof on this one and I highly recommend picking it up!
The best third person tower defense on steam. Quality game well worth the price of purchase.

Pretty fun and addicting game. Good cartoonish art, so far it was nicely optimized, no crashes and no fps lag at all. The co-op mode is even funnier of course, since you can use a lot of creativity with a friend to complete the levels. Could use a larger amount of levels, though, without the need for DLC, that is. Still, a pretty good game.

Orcs must Die 2 is the sequel that fans of the first game (which I also recommend that you play first) were waiting for. It keeps all of the fun aspects of the previous game while adding plenty of new things as well as addressing the criticisms of the original, the largest of which was lack of multiplayer. The game now has full Co-Op, as well as a new character in the form of the Sorceress. The game adds new levels new enemies, and an arsenal of new weapons and traps to massacre the hordes of orcs with, all while keeping the theme of the original, including the FANTASTIC soundtrack. I would say this feels more like an expansion pack than a sequel, but then you also have to take into account that both this game and the original were very cheap in price on release, and both have been on sale countless times since then. A great deal of fun, and if you like the idea of slaughtering huge hordes of orcs with hilarious trap combinations, you NEED to buy this game.
Very interesting game and can be quite challenging, have never played co-op before but I do intend too and hopefully soon as I am sure the expierence would be twice as better.

I didn't do a review for OMD2? I'll keep it short then..   It should be great for anyone that likes to play tower defense games. Just like in OMD1, you feel rewarded while progressing through the game. There is co-op too, which makes it even better.  10/10
Oh dear, The best few pound I ever spent! Easy achievements with a little hard work.. And so much fun with friends

Orcs Must Die! 2 Is one of the greatest tower defense games I have ever played. It can be very addictive, especially with a good skill asset the desire to send orcs to their Impending doom! Orcs Must Die! 2 Is a two player co-op tower defense game with a lot of freedom In choosing your traps, weapons, helpers In battle, and spells. You unlock things by playing levels and earning skulls as a currency to purchase upgrades. I strongly recommend playing this.

A good game to play with a friend as I did. Choose to use traps, or choose to goes balls out with magic or weapons. The Endless mode is always the best after you beat the story line. Just make sure your computer can handle that many enemies on the screen at once (40+).

Make a devious plan, then execute it with full carnage. Wave after wave of orcs will get crushed, sliced and maimed by a machinery you designed. And if that fails, you can always use an arsenal of spells to handle the rest of them. Or even better, combine your spells with your traps!  This game is awesome.

Kiss your index finger goodbye along with your left mouse button. Its the game that put 'repetative strain' in the dictionary and on the tongues of all doctors.   Its Orc crushing burning shooting and whisping away mayhem, for hours of endless fun.   Its a great game and a must buy. A little steep at full asking price but, the complete edition is a great deal for anything under £10. imo.
Fast paced and a great multi-player game.
Yes. just yes. Awesome game. very close to my pesonal game of the decade, however yo play i find it hard to believe anyone would not have fun here :)
